senses.de: The skill or power to do something.
senses.ex: He has the ability to make everyone laugh.

Tips.title: Collocation Importance
Tips.description: Understand common word pairings with 'ability' to express specific skills or powers effectively.
Tips.example: Her natural ability at chess is impressive.

Tips.title: Action-focused
Tips.description: 'Ability' is often used with verbs that show action to highlight someone's skills in performing tasks.
Tips.example: His ability to solve complex problems quickly is well-known.

senses.de: The level of skill you have in doing something.
senses.ex: She has the ability to play piano very well.

Tips.title: Skill Level
Tips.description: Use 'ability' to discuss how well someone can do something, hinting at proficiency level.
Tips.example: Her ability in mathematics is exceptional.

Tips.title: Learning Progress
Tips.description: Indicate the potential for improvement or learning speed when talking about one's 'ability'.
Tips.example: His ability to learn new languages quickly surprised everyone.

senses.de: The fact or condition of being good at doing something.
senses.ex: He demonstrated great ability in handling the crisis.

Tips.title: Condition Clarity
Tips.description: Use 'ability' to clarify that being good at something may be due to the current state or condition.
Tips.example: After the training, their ability in crisis management improved.

Tips.title: Handling Situations
Tips.description: Focus on the use of 'ability' when discussing someone's capability to manage or deal with situations.
Tips.example: Her ability to lead the team through challenges is admired by all.

senses.de: The mental or physical power or skill needed to do something.
senses.ex: He has lost his ability to walk since the accident.

Tips.title: Physical Changes
Tips.description: Consider changes in physical or mental state that might affect one's 'ability' to do something.
Tips.example: His ability to concentrate has waned since the incident.

Tips.title: Artistic Performance
Tips.description: Highlight 'ability' when evaluating an individual's creative or artistic skills.
Tips.example: She displayed her artistic ability during the live performance.

Aptitude.wordDefinition:
Aptitude refers to a person's potential to learn a particular skill or subject quickly and easily. It is a natural inclination or talent for something that can be developed.

For example, someone with an aptitude for math may find it easier to learn and understand math concepts than someone without that aptitude.

Ability is what a person can do now, while aptitude is a person's potential to learn and do something well in the future.

Capability.wordDefinition:
Capability refers to a person's potential or capacity to do something. It refers to inherent qualities that allow someone to do something if they put in the effort to learn or develop a skill.

For example, I have the capability to learn how to play the guitar means that I have the necessary qualities to learn to play it.

Ability is what someone can currently do, and capability is what someone potentially can do in the future with the right training or experience.

Capacity.wordDefinition:
Capacity refers to the potential to hold, contain, or undertake something. It refers to the amount of something that can be held or the extent to which something can be done.

For example, the capacity of a water tank, the capacity of a battery or the capacity of a room.

Ability focuses on skills or talents while capacity focuses on potential or the amount something can hold. Both words are applicable in different contexts and it is important to use the correct word depending on the situation.

Competence.wordDefinition:
Competence refers to the ability to perform a particular task or job successfully, taking into account skills, knowledge, and experience.

For example, a person may possess the ability to play the guitar, but without practice and training, they may not have the competence to perform in front of an audience.

Ability is a person's natural talent or skill, while competence is the skill and knowledge acquired through training and experience necessary to perform a task successfully.

Both terms are applicable in different contexts – ability for recognizing one's potential and competence for measuring and improving performance in professional settings.

Power.wordDefinition:
Power usually refers to a person's ability to control or influence something or someone. For instance, a leader may have the power to make decisions that affect a group of people.

Ability refers to the skills or talents we have, whereas power refers to the authority or control we possess over others or a situation.

Proficiency.wordDefinition:
Proficiency refers to a high degree of skill or expertise in a particular area. It suggests mastery or competency in a specific field.

If someone has proficiency in playing the piano, it means they have a high level of skill and expertise in playing it, they may have even mastered it.

Proficiency is applicable in situations where a person has already gained a high level of competence in a particular area.

Skill.wordDefinition:
Ability refers to a natural talent or potential to do something, whereas a skill is developed through practice and experience.

For example, someone may have an ability for music, but they need to develop their skills through practice and training to become a proficient musician.

Ability is something we are born with, whereas skill is something we can learn and improve upon. Ability is applicable to things we are naturally good at, while skill is applicable to things we work hard to become good at.

Talent.wordDefinition:
Talent refers to a natural skill or aptitude a person has that comes naturally to them. It is something that they are born with and may not necessarily require as much practice or learning.

For example, if someone has a talent for singing, it means they have a natural ability to sing well without much training or practice.

Ability is something that can be learned or improved through practice and experience, while talent is something that seems to come naturally to a person.

Both words are applicable in various contexts, such as sports, arts, and academic subjects. Knowing one's abilities and talents can help a person make informed choices about their career, hobbies, and passions.

quotes.Text: I think that more flow of information, the ability to stay connected to more people makes people more effective as people. And I mean, that's true socially. It makes you have more fun, right. It feels better to be more connected to all these people. You have a richer life.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Mark Zuckerberg

quotes.Text: What material success does is provide you with the ability to concentrate on other things that really matter. And that is being able to make a difference, not only in your own life, but in other people's lives.
quotes.Title: American Entertainer
quotes.Name: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.Text: You have the ability to choose which way you want to go. You have to believe great things are going to happen in your life. Do everything you can - prepare, pray and achieve - to make it happen.
quotes.Title: American Scientist
quotes.Name: Ben Carson

quotes.Text: Being more aware creates responsibility. What does responsibility mean? It means the ability to respond. The more conscious you are in your ability to respond, the more creative you'll be.
quotes.Title: American Speaker
quotes.Name: Deepak Chopra

quotes.Text: Acting is different from stand-up. It gives you this ability to enter into another character, to create another person.
quotes.Title: American Comedian
quotes.Name: Robin Williams

quotes.Text: I'm going to use all my tools, my God-given ability, and make the best life I can with it.
quotes.Title: American Basketball Player
quotes.Name: LeBron James

quotes.Text: Our ability to handle life's challenges is a measure of our strength of character.
quotes.Title: American Speaker
quotes.Name: Les Brown

quotes.Text: As we advance in life we learn the limits of our abilities.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Henry Ford

quotes.Text: For success, attitude is equally as important as ability.
quotes.Title: Scottish Novelist
quotes.Name: Walter Scott

quotes.Text: Wealth is the ability to fully experience life.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Henry David Thoreau
